definition: lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
a unit of length/inch/thumb
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: But that was probably asking too much.
sentences.chinese: 但那也許是得寸進尺了。

sentences.english: What else do you want? Egg in you beer? You already have it good.
sentences.chinese: 還想怎麼樣？得寸進尺嗎？該有的好處你已經得到了。

sentences.english: "What about two goggles?" Wes wants to know next.
sentences.chinese: “那買兩個護目鏡呢？”維斯有些得寸進尺。

sentences.english: The doctors told me I was pushing my luck.
sentences.chinese: 醫生說我這是在得寸進尺。

definition: sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to use force
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
docile and obedient/all obedience
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
ability/skill
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
